event.descr:
Notification of a generated syslog message. Apart from the jnxSyslogTrap objects, this notification can include one or more attribute-value pairs. The attribute-value pairs shall be identified by objects jnxSyslogAvAttribute and jnxSyslogAvValue.

jnxSyslogEventName %parm[#1]%;

jnxSyslogTimestamp %parm[#2]%;

jnxSyslogSeverity %parm[#3]%;

emergency(1) alert(2) critical(3) error(4) warning(5) notice(6) info(7) debug(8)

jnxSyslogFacility %parm[#4]%;

kernel(1) user(2) mail(3) daemon(4) auth(5) syslog(6) lpr(7) news(8) uucp(9) cron(10) authPriv(11) ftp(12) ntp(13) security(14) console(15) local0(17) dfc(18) local2(19) firewall(20) pfe(21) conflict(22) change(23) interact(24)

jnxSyslogProcessId %parm[#5]%;

jnxSyslogProcessName %parm[#6]%;

jnxSyslogHostName %parm[#7]%;

jnxSyslogMessage %parm[#8]%;
event.logmsg: jnxSyslogTrap trap received jnxSyslogEventName=%parm[#1]% jnxSyslogTimestamp=%parm[#2]% jnxSyslogSeverity=%parm[#3]% jnxSyslogFacility=%parm[#4]% jnxSyslogProcessId=%parm[#5]% jnxSyslogProcessName=%parm[#6]% jnxSyslogHostName=%parm[#7]% jnxSyslogMessage=%parm[#8]%
